metadata.title: CVE-2020-12695 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
The Open Connectivity Foundation UPnP specification before 2020-04-17 does not forbid the acceptance of a subscription request with a delivery URL on a different network segment than the fully qualified event-subscription URL, aka the CallStranger issue.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12695` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gupnp-1.2 - 1.2.3-1
libgupnp-1.2-1 - 1.2.3-1
No subscription required

minidlna - 1.2.1+dfsg-3
No subscription required

eapoltest - 2:2.9-1ubuntu10
hostapd - 2:2.9-1ubuntu10
wpagui - 2:2.9-1ubuntu10
wpasupplicant - 2:2.9-1ubuntu10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gupnp package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.3-1').
minidlna package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.1+dfsg-3').
pupnp-1.8 package in kinetic is affected and needs fixing.
wpa package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:2.9-1ubuntu10').
